Package org.securecryptoconfig

Class SCCKey

java.lang.Object
org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCKey
org.securecryptoconfig.SCCKey
public class SCCKey
extends AbstractSCCKey
Container for a key or keypair used for cryptography operations like symmetric or asymmetric encryption. SCCKey contains a byte[] representation of a key as well as all the parameters needed to define the type and use case of the key or keypair.
Author:
Lisa

  • Constructor Details

    • SCCKey

      public SCCKey​(SCCKey.KeyType type, byte[] key, java.lang.String algorithm)
      Constructor which gets the SCCKey.KeyType, the byte[] representation of the key and the algorithm of its creation. This constructor is used in for SCCKeys of SCCKey.KeyType.Symmetric. If a new SCCKey should be created call createKey(KeyUseCase).
      Parameters:
      type - : choice of SCCKey.KeyType
      key - : byte[] representation of key
      algorithm - : used for key creation

    • SCCKey

      public SCCKey​(SCCKey.KeyType type, byte[] publicKey, byte[] privateKey, java.lang.String algorithm)
      Constructor which gets the SCCKey.KeyType, the byte[] representation of the public and private key and the algorithm of its creation. This constructor is used in for SCCKeys of SCCKey.KeyType.Asymmetric. If a new SCCKey should be created call createKey(KeyUseCase).
      Parameters:
      type - : choice of SCCKey.KeyType
      publicKey - : byte[] representation of public key
      privateKey - : byte[] representation of private key
      algorithm - : used for key creation

  • Method Details

    • getKeyType

      public SCCKey.KeyType getKeyType()
      Description copied from class: AbstractSCCKey
      Get SCCKey.KeyType of SCCKey. A key can either be SCCKey.KeyType.Symmetric Or SCCKey.KeyType.Asymmetric. According to its type a key can be used for different cryptographic use cases.
      Specified by:
      getKeyType in class AbstractSCCKey
      Returns:
      SCCKey.KeyType

      Specified by:

      Returns:

      Returns:

    • createKey

      public static SCCKey createKey​(SCCKey.KeyUseCase useCase) throws COSE.CoseException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException, SCCException
      Create a key for a specific SCCKey.KeyUseCase. Depending of specified SCCKey.KeyUseCase the resulting SCCKey can be used for: - SCCKey.KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption: SecureCryptoConfigInterface.encryptSymmetric(AbstractSCCKey, byte[]), SecureCryptoConfigInterface.encryptSymmetric(AbstractSCCKey,PlaintextContainerInterface), SecureCryptoConfigInterface.decryptSymmetric(AbstractSCCKey, AbstractSCCCiphertext), SecureCryptoConfigInterface.reEncryptSymmetric(AbstractSCCKey, AbstractSCCCiphertext) - SCCKey.KeyUseCase.AsymmetricEncryption: SecureCryptoConfigInterface.encryptAsymmetric(AbstractSCCKey, byte[]), SecureCryptoConfigInterface.reEncryptAsymmetric(AbstractSCCKey, AbstractSCCCiphertext) SecureCryptoConfigInterface.encryptAsymmetric(AbstractSCCKey, PlaintextContainerInterface), SecureCryptoConfigInterface.decryptAsymmetric(AbstractSCCKey, AbstractSCCCiphertext) - SCCKey.KeyUseCase.Signing: SecureCryptoConfigInterface.sign(AbstractSCCKey, byte[]), SecureCryptoConfigInterface.sign(AbstractSCCKey, PlaintextContainerInterface), SecureCryptoConfigInterface.validateSignature(AbstractSCCKey, AbstractSCCSignature), SecureCryptoConfigInterface.updateSignature(AbstractSCCKey, byte[]), SecureCryptoConfigInterface.updateSignature(AbstractSCCKey, PlaintextContainerInterface) Depending on the SCCKey.KeyUseCase the SCCKey get a different SCCKey.KeyType
      Parameters:
      useCase - : for which Scenario is the key needed? Give a value of SCCKey.KeyUseCase
      Returns:
      SCCKey: key that can be used for the specified use case
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      SCCException

    • createSymmetricKeyWithPassword

      public static SCCKey createSymmetricKeyWithPassword​(byte[] password) throws SCCException
      Creation of key derived from a given password that can be used for symmetric encryption based on Secure Crypto Config file.
      Parameters:
      password - : as byte[]
      Returns:
      SCCKey
      Throws:
      SCCException

    • createSymmetricKeyWithPassword

      public static SCCKey createSymmetricKeyWithPassword​(PlaintextContainer password) throws COSE.CoseException, SCCException
      Creation of key derived from a given password that can be used for symmetric encryption based on Secure Crypto Config file.
      Parameters:
      password - : as PlaintextContainer
      Returns:
      SCCKey
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException
      SCCException
